channel.title: Hacker News - English
channel.description: Hacker News articles summarized and translated to English

item.title: What If Tariffs?
item.description:
The inspiration behind the WHAT IF…TARIFFS. model lies in the current events unfolding in today’s world. The unique details on its dial and battery cover hint at the US tariffs imposed on Switzerland.

Read more

item.title: Asbestosis
item.description:
In 1913 the Cape Asbestos Company built a huge asbestos factory beside the River Roding in Barking. My grandfather worked for another Cape Asbestos plant on Tolpits Lane in Watford. I don't remember very much about my grandfather because he died when I was 8.

Read more

item.title: Advent of Code 2025: Number of puzzles reduce from 25 to 12 for the first time
item.description:
I make Advent of Code. Advent of Code uses OAuth to confirm your identity through other services. Then, the service you use tells the Advent of Code servers that you're really you.

Read more

item.title: Bitmovin (YC S15) Is Hiring Engineering ICs and Managers in Europe
item.description:
CAREERS AT BITMOVIN Come work with us. Think through the customer lens. item.title: LaserTweezer – Optical Trap
item.description:
LaserTweezer – Optical Trap Optical Tweezers are scientific instruments to manipulate objects of microscopic size. Construction Details Construction Details of “DIY Laser Tweezer” [7]: Conventional DVD drive optical pickups emit a laser beam form a diode that passes through a diffraction grating, a polarizing beam splitter and is then collimated and focused onto a plane. To prevent overexposing of the camera by the laser beam a scatter disk made from black cardboard material with two slits of about 10° is positioned in the optical path just in front of the camera.

Read more

item.title: Writing a RISC-V Emulator in Rust
item.description:
Writing a RISC-V Emulator in Rust NOTE: This project is actively ongoing. Introduction This is the book for writing a 64-bit RISC-V emulator from scratch in Rust. You'll learn the basic computer architecture such as ISA, previleged architecture, exceptions, interrupts, peripheral devices, and virtual memory system from making an emulator.

Read more
